Dear Dr. Goodwin:
   
  Thank you for your suggestion. I think that is doable for me. I just wanted to ask you if you have any other manual of using CANTERA with C++ other than the class documentation available online. And if you do, could you please tell me how we can get it. I am a post doctoral fellow at West Virginia University and we intend to use CANTERA for academic research. 
   
  Thank you
  Raju

Dave Goodwin <dgoodwin@...> wrote:
          You are right - Interface kinetics are not fully supported in the
Fortran interface. I would recommend writing those portions of your
code in C++... you can link them to a driver program in Fortran or
any other desired language...

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "spakalap" <spakalap@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Everybody,
> 
> We are new to CANTERA. We want to link CANTERA to our FORTRAN program 
> and use it to model interface reaction kinetics. It apprears to me that 
> the FORTRAN interface that comes with the installation does not support 
> interface kinetics feature yet. Is this true or am I missing something? 
> Can somebody please help me with this.
> 
> Thank you
> Raju
>
